snippet: New York City is facing a lawsuit by five men who were convicted and exonerated in the rape of a Central Park jogger, the subject of a new documentary by the filmmaker Ken Burns.
abstract: Documentary filmmaker Ken Burns has been subpoenaed by New York City attorneys seeking material from recently completed documentary The Central Park Five, which explores the lives of five men who were convicted and later exonerated in the racially charged 1989 Central Park jogger rape case; city is hoping film's unpublished interviews and unreleased footage might help defend against a $50 million lawsuit filed by the men in 2003.
lead_paragraph: New York City is facing a lawsuit by five men who were convicted and exonerated in the rape of a Central Park jogger, the subject of a new documentary by the filmmaker Ken Burns.

headline.seo: N.Y. City Subpoenas Ken Burns Film on ’89 Jogger Rape
headline.main: City Subpoenas Film Outtakes as It Defends Suit by Men Cleared in ’89 Rape
headline.print_headline: City Subpoenas Film Outtakes as It Defends Suit by Men Cleared in ’89 Rape
